cosmology.name: The Great Wheel
cosmology.description: The default D&D cosmology includes more than two dozen planes. The most common understanding visualizes them as concentric wheels, with the material realms at the center. The Inner Planes form a wheel around the Material Plane, enveloped in the Ethereal Plane. The Outer Planes form another wheel around that one, arranged according to alignment, with the Outlands linking them all.

alternateConfigurations.name: World Tree
alternateConfigurations.description: Planes situated among the roots and branches of a great cosmic tree (literally or figuratively)

alternateConfigurations.name: Astral Above Elemental Below
alternateConfigurations.description: Material realms suspended between two other realities: the astral realms (the Astral Plane and the Outer Planes) above and the elemental realms (the Inner Planes) below

alternateConfigurations.name: Simplified Cosmology
alternateConfigurations.description: A cosmology with fewer planes: a Material Plane; the Transitive Planes; a single undifferentiated Elemental Plane; an Overheaven where good deities and Celestials dwell; and an Underworld where evil deities and Fiends reside

alternateConfigurations.name: Orbital Cosmology
alternateConfigurations.description: Planes arranged in a complex system of orbits, with planes exerting greater influence on the Material Plane the closer they draw to it

planeCategories.name: Material Realms
planeCategories.description: Most D&D worlds are located on the Material Plane, which has two planar echoes: the Feywild and the Shadowfell.

planeCategories.name: Transitive Planes
planeCategories.description: The Ethereal Plane and the Astral Plane are boundless realms that provide passage between other planes of existence.

planeCategories.name: Inner Planes
planeCategories.description: The four Elemental Planes (Air, Earth, Fire, and Water), plus the Para-elemental Planes between them, are the Inner Planes.

planeCategories.name: Outer Planes
planeCategories.description: Seventeen Outer Planes correspond to the nine alignments and shades of philosophical difference between them.

planeCategories.name: Positive and Negative Planes
planeCategories.description: These two planes enfold the rest of the cosmology, providing the raw forces of life and death that underlie all existence in the multiverse.

planes.name: Para-elemental Plane of Ice
planes.philosophicalEssence: The interaction and contrast between elemental air and elemental water, manifesting as an endless frozen expanse of bitter cold, raging blizzards, and relentless survival.
planes.emotionalInfluence: The inhabitants engage in a never-ending battle to prove their strength and ensure their survival. The plane embodies the harshness of extreme cold and the relentless challenge of enduring a hostile frozen environment.

physicalProperties.shape: A seemingly endless glacier swept by constant, raging blizzards with frozen caverns winding through it
physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: Air is breathable but filled with constant raging blizzards, powerful winds, and driving snow. Conditions are extremely harsh for non-native creatures.

temperature.description: The Frostfell is a seemingly endless glacier swept by constant, raging blizzards. Bitter cold makes it a dangerous place to travel.

physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Constant raging blizzards with powerful winds and driving snow

timeFlow.description: Time flows normally on the Inner Planes unless otherwise specified.

hazards.name: Bitter Cold
hazards.description: The Frostfell's bitter cold makes it a dangerous place to travel. The extreme cold environment poses a constant threat to non-native creatures.

gravityModel.description: Normal gravity on the glacier surface

hazards.name: Constant Raging Blizzards
hazards.description: The Plane of Ice is swept by constant, raging blizzards with powerful winds and driving snow. Most planar voyagers keep to the air, braving the powerful winds and driving snow to avoid setting foot on the great glacier.

hazards.name: Dangerous Native Creatures
hazards.description: Frozen caverns wind through the Plane of Ice, home to yetis, white dragons, and other creatures of cold. The Frostfell's monsters and bitter cold make it a dangerous place to travel.

environmentalEffects.name: Never-Ending Battle for Survival
environmentalEffects.description: The inhabitants of the plane engage in a never-ending battle to prove their strength and ensure their survival.
environmentalEffects.mechanicalEffect: All creatures on the plane face constant environmental pressure from extreme cold, blizzards, and hostile native creatures, requiring ongoing vigilance and resource management.

planarConnections.name: Border with Elemental Plane of Air
planarConnections.description: The Para-elemental Plane of Ice forms the border between the Plane of Air and the Plane of Water. Near the Plane of Air, the Mistral Reach is a region of frigid winds and driving snowstorms. Rain and snow fall only in the part of the Plane of Air nearest to the Para-elemental Plane of Ice. Earth motes in the Mistral Reach are covered with snow and ice.

planarConnections.name: Border with Elemental Plane of Water
planarConnections.description: Bordering the Para-elemental Plane of Ice is the Sea of Ice on the Elemental Plane of Water. The frigid water is choked with icebergs and sheet ice, which are inhabited by cold-loving creatures from the Plane of Ice. Drifting icebergs can carry these creatures farther into the Plane of Water to threaten ships and islands in warmer seas.

planarConnections.name: Ethereal Curtain to Plane of Ice
planarConnections.description: An aquamarine-colored curtain in the Deep Ethereal leads to a region of the Border Ethereal connected to the Para-elemental Plane of Ice. The curtain is distinguishable by texture and temperature, reflecting the frigid nature of the Plane of Ice.

adventureThemes: Survival against extreme cold and hostile environment
Interaction and contrast between elemental air and elemental water
Braving powerful winds and driving snow

crossReferences.description: Elemental Plane of Air section references the Mistral Reach near the Para-elemental Plane of Ice, a region of frigid winds and driving snowstorms with earth motes covered in snow and ice.

Elemental Plane of Water section references the Sea of Ice bordering the Para-elemental Plane of Ice, with frigid water choked with icebergs and sheet ice inhabited by cold-loving creatures from the Plane of Ice.
Ethereal Plane section lists the Para-elemental Plane of Ice as entry 10 on the d12 Ethereal Curtains table with an aquamarine curtain color.
Chapter 3 referenced for Environmental Effects that may apply to extreme cold environments.

planarTravelMethods.name: Planar Portals
planarTravelMethods.description: A portal is a stationary, interplanar connection that links a specific location on one plane to a specific location on another. Some portals are vortices joining an Elemental Plane with a similar location on the Material Plane.
requirements: Meeting portal requirements (command, key item, random, situation, or time)
risks: Portals may not be open at all times
destinations: Any plane connected by the specific portal

planarTravelMethods.name: Planar Travel Spells
planarTravelMethods.description: Spells such as Gate and Plane Shift can directly transport adventurers to the Para-elemental Plane of Ice.
requirements: Ability to cast the relevant spell
Proper tuning fork frequency for Plane Shift

planarTravelMethods.name: Ethereal Curtain
planarTravelMethods.description: Traveling through the Deep Ethereal, an aquamarine-colored curtain leads to the Border Ethereal connected to the Para-elemental Plane of Ice.
requirements: Access to the Deep Ethereal via Plane Shift, Gate, or magical portal
risks: Ether cyclones in the Deep Ethereal
Travel time of 1d10 × 10 hours between curtains

savingThrowProbabilities.formula: P(fail | modifier m) = max(0.05, min(0.95, (DC - 1 - m) / 20))
